config_file.description: Configuration file in JSON format. See examples/creds.json

console_url.description: The Prisma Cloud Compute Console URL

skip_cert_verification.description: Whether or not to skip certificate verification

collections.description: Collections used to scope the rule.

disabled.description: Whether or not to disable the rule.

effect.description: The effect of the rule. Can be set to 'ignore', 'alert', 'block', or 'alert, block'.

verbose.description: Whether or not to provide verbose output for blocked requests.

block.description: Whether or not to block if this check is failed. Setting to 'false' will only alert if the check is failed.
Compliance checks. Omitted checks are ignored.
Rules that make up the policy.

block_message.description: Message to display when an image is blocked.

collections.description: Collections used to scope the rule.

disabled.description: Whether or not to disable the rule.

effect.description: The effect of the rule. Can be set to 'ignore', 'alert', 'block', or 'alert, block'.

grace_days.description: Number of days to suppress the rule's block effect. Measured from date the vulnerability was fixed. If there's no fix, measured from the date the vulnerability was published.

only_fixed.description: Whether or not to apply the rule only when vendor fixes are available.

verbose.description: Whether or not to display a detailed message when blocked.

disabled.description: Whether or not to disable vulnerability alerts.

value.description: Minimum vulnerability severity to generate an alert. Can be set to 0=off, 1=low, 4=medium, 7=high, and 9=critical.

enabled.description: Whether or not to block when vulnerabilities are found.

value.description: Minimum vulnerability severity to block. Can be set to 0=off, 1=low, 4=medium, 7=high, and 9=critical.

effect.description: Action to take if the CVE is found. Can be set to 'ignore', 'alert', or 'block'.

enabled.description: Whether or not to enable the CVE rule expiration.

block.description: List of rules for handling specific CVEs.

effect.description: Action to take if a tagged CVE is found. Can be set to 'ignore', 'alert', or 'block'.

enabled.description: Whether or not to enable the tag rule expiration.

block.description: List of rules for handling specific tags.
Rules that make up the policy.

application_ids.description: Targeted application IDs (for app-embedded). Values must end in a wildcard (*).

color.description: A hex color code for the collection to display in the Console.

description.description: A free-form text description of the collection.

block_message.description: Message to display for blocked requests.

collections.description: Collections used to scope the rule.

disabled.description: Whether or not to disable the rule.

effect.description: The effect of the rule. Can be set to 'ignore', 'alert', 'block', or 'alert, block'.

show_passed_checks.description: Whether or not to report both failed and passed compliance checks.

verbose.description: Whether or not to provide verbose output for blocked requests.

block.description: Whether or not to block if this check is failed. Setting to 'false' will only alert if the check is failed.
Compliance checks. Omitted checks are ignored.
Rules that make up the policy.

learning_disabled.description: Whether or not to disable automatic behavioral learning.

advanced_protection.description: Whether or not to enable advanced protection.

cloud_metadata_enforcement.description: Whether or not to enable cloud metadata access monitoring.

collections.description: Collections used to scope the rule.

disabled.description: Whether or not to disable the rule.

kubernetes_enforcement.description: Whether or not to detect attacks against the cluster.

wildfire_analysis.description: The effect to be used when WildFire analysis is enabled. Can be set to 'block', 'alert', or 'disable'.

action.description: The action to perform if the custom rule applies. Can be set to 'audit' or 'incident'.

effect.description: The effect to be used. Can be set to 'block', 'prevent', 'alert', or 'allow'.

allowed.description: Allowed domains. Wildcard prefixes are supported.

denied.description: Denied domains. Wildcard prefixes are supported.

deny_effect.description: The effect to be used. Can be set to 'block', 'prevent', 'alert', or 'disable'.

allowed.description: List of allowed file system paths.

backdoor_files.description: Whether or not to monitor files that can create or persist backdoors (SSH or admin account config files).

check_new_files.description: Whether or not to detect changes to binaries and certificates.

denied.description: List of denied file system paths.

deny_effect.description: The effect to be used. Can be set to 'block', 'prevent', 'alert', or 'disable'.

skip_encrypted_binaries.description: Whether or not to skip encrypted binaries.

suspicious_elf_headers.description: Whether or not to detect suspicious ELF headers.

allowed_outbound_ips.description: List of allowed outbound IP addresses.

denied_outbound_ips.description: List of denied outbound IP addresses.

deny_effect.description: The effect to be used. Can be set to 'block', 'alert', or 'disable'.

detect_port_scan.description: Whether or not to detect port scans.

skip_modified_processes.description: Whether or not to skip network monitoring for modified processes.

skip_raw_sockets.description: Whether or not to skip raw socket detection.

deny.description: Whether or not to deny the connection.
Whether or not to deny the connection.
Whether or not to deny the connection.
Whether or not to deny the connection.

check_crypto_miners.description: Whether or not to detect crypto miners.

check_lateral_movement.description: Whether or not to detect processes that can be used for lateral movement exploits.

check_parent_child.description: Whether or not to check for parent-child relationship when comparing spawned processes in the model.

check_suid_binaries.description: Whether or not to check for process-elevating privileges (SUID bit).

deny_effect.description: The effect to be used. Can be set to 'block', 'prevent', 'alert', or 'disable'.

skip_modified.description: Whether or not to skip detection of processes started from modified binaries

skip_reverse_shell.description: Whether or not skip detection of reverse shells.

block.description: Rules that make up the policy.

role_arn.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume.

skip_cert_verification.description: SkipVerify if should skip certificate verification in tls communication.

url.description: URL is the server base url.

use_aws_role.description: Indicates if authentication should be done with the instance's attached credentials (EC2 IAM Role).

plain.description: Plain text value for the secret. Note: marshalling to JSON will convert to an encrypted value

block.description: The plain and encrypted version of the API token (the plain version is never stored in the database)

plain.description: Plain text value for the secret. Note: marshalling to JSON will convert to an encrypted value

block.description: Plain and encrypted version of the credential (the plain version is never stored in the database)

ldap_group.description: Whether or not the group is an LDAP group.

oauth_group.description: Whether or not the group is an OAuth group.

oidc_group.description: Whether or not the group is an OpenID Connect group.

saml_group.description: Whether or not the group is a SAML group.

collections.description: Specifies the set of Defenders in-scope for working on a scan job.

project.description: Names of projects which the user can access.

block_message.description: Message to display for blocked requests.

collections.description: Collections used to scope the rule.

disabled.description: Whether or not to disable the rule.

effect.description: The effect of the rule. Can be set to 'ignore', 'alert', 'block', or 'alert, block'.

show_passed_checks.description: Whether or not to report both failed and passed compliance checks.

verbose.description: Whether or not to provide verbose output for blocked requests.

block.description: Whether or not to block if this check is failed. Setting to 'false' will only alert if the check is failed.
Compliance checks. Omitted checks are ignored.
Rules that make up the policy.

collections.description: Collections used to scope the rule.

disabled.description: Whether or not to disable the rule.
Whether or not to disable host activity collection.

docker_enabled.description: Whether or not to collect docker commands.

readonly_docker_enabled.description: Whether or not to collect read-only docker commands.

service_activities_enabled.description: Whether or not to collect activity from services.

sshd_enabled.description: Whether or not to collect new SSH sessions.

sudo_enabled.description: Whether or not to collect commands ran with sudo or su.

allowed_processes.description: List of processes and files to allow during anti-malware checks.

crypto_miners.description: The effect to be used when crypto miners are detected. Can be set to 'prevent', 'alert', or 'disable'.

custom_feed.description: The effect to be used when malware from custom feeds is detected. Can be set to 'alert' or 'disable'.

detect_compiler_generated_binary.description: Whether or not to detect compiler-generated binaries.

encrypted_binaries.description: The effect to be used when encrypted or packed binaries are detected. Can be set to 'alert' or 'disable'.

execution_flow_hijack.description: The effect to be used when execution flow hijacking is detected. Can be set to 'alert' or 'disable'.

intelligence_feed.description: The effect to be used when malware according to Prisma Cloud Compute is detected. Can be set to 'alert' or 'disable'.

reverse_shell.description: The effect to be used when reverse shell attacks are detected. Can be set to 'alert' or 'disable'.

service_unknown_origin_binary.description: The effect to be used when non-packaged binaries are created or ran by a service. Can be set to 'prevent', 'alert', or 'disable'.

skip_ssh_tracking.description: Whether or not to skip tracking of SSH events.

suspicious_elf_headers.description: The effect to be used when binaries with suspicious ELF headers are detected. Can be set to 'alert' or 'disable'.

temp_filesystem_processes.description: The effect to be used when processes are ran from a temporary file system. Can be set to 'prevent', 'alert', or 'disable'.

user_unknown_origin_binary.description: The effect to be used when non-packaged binaries are created or ran by a user. Can be set to 'prevent', 'alert', or 'disable'.

webshell.description: The effect to be used when webshell attacks are detected. Can be set to 'prevent', 'alert', or 'disable'.

wildfire_analysis.description: The effect to be used when WildFire analysis is enabled. Can be set to 'alert' or 'disable'.

effect.description: The effect to be used. Can be set to 'prevent' or 'alert'.

paths.description: List of processes and files to deny during anti-malware checks.

action.description: The action to perform if the custom rule applies. Can be set to 'audit' or 'incident'.

effect.description: The effect to be used. Can be set to 'prevent', 'alert', or 'allow'.

allowed.description: Allowed domains. Wildcard prefixes are supported.

denied.description: Denied domains. Wildcard prefixes are supported.

deny_effect.description: The effect to be used. Can be set to 'prevent', 'alert', or 'disable'.

intelligence_feed.description: The effect to be used when resolving suspicious domains according to Prisma Cloud Compute. Can be set to 'prevent', 'alert', or 'disable'.

allowed_processes.description: List of processes allowed to generate file system events on monitored files.

excluded_files.description: List of file names to ignore. Pattern matching is supported.

metadata.description: Whether or not to monitor file metadata changes.

read.description: Whether or not to monitor file reads.

recursive.description: Whether or not to recursively monitor files starting at `path`.

write.description: Whether or not to monitor file writes.

regex.description: List of regular expressions to use when inspecting the log file.

allowed_outbound_ips.description: List of allowed outbound IP addresses.

custom_feed.description: The effect to be used when connecting to suspicious IPs according to custom feeds. Can be set to 'alert' or 'disable'.

denied_outbound_ips.description: List of denied outbound IP addresses.

deny_effect.description: The effect to be used. Can be set to 'alert' or 'disable'.

intelligence_feed.description: The effect to be used when connecting to suspicious IPs according to Prisma Cloud Compute. Can be set to 'alert' or 'disable'.

deny.description: Whether or not to deny the connection.
Whether or not to deny the connection.

id.description: The ID of the registry settings.

cap.description: The maximum number of images to scan from each repository, sorted by most recently modified.

collections.description: The set of Defenders available for scanning.

credential.description: The name of the credential from the credentials store to use for authenticating with the registry.

harbor_deployment_security.description: Use temporary tokens provided by Harbor to scan images in projects with the deployment security setting enabled.

jfrog_repo_types.description: JFrog Artifactory repository types to scan.

os.description: The base OS of the registry images.

repository.description: Repositories to scan. Pattern matching is supported.

scanners.description: Number of Defenders that can be utilized for each scan job.

tag.description: Tags to scan. Pattern matching is supported.

version_pattern.description: Pattern used by the scanner to identify the latest tags without querying the registry for additional metadata. If a pattern specifies both date and version, date takes precedence over version.

collections.description: Specifies the set of Defenders in-scope for working on a scan job.

project.description: Names of projects which the user can access.
